titlestmt.titleproper: Near East Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 4
A Guide to the Near East Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 4 FA1307

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 16:19:43 -0400.

did.unittitle: Near East Foundation records, Audiovisual Materials, RG 4

physdesc.extent: 42 Film Reels, NEF Foundation film collection encompasses approximately 18,000 feet of film on 42 reels. The collection includes 1 negative and 41 prints in 16mm and 35mm formats.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed films, only available in their original film format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amateur films in the Middle East from early to mid 20th century from work done by the Near East Foundation (NEF).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REV. JAMES T. ALBERTSON, PEOPLE OF PROMISE ORG. A home movie of visitors from the NEF Foundation touring the Holy Land admiring the sights of a modern city with art and architechtural history. Film has footage of temples, ancient Egyptian architecture, and street level views of the city. Some rural footage is also present with women and children going about daily activities such as gathering water and cultivating the land with camels. The film ends with examples of popular dance for the locals.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amateur film with footage of landscape and points of interest for international visitors including the beach front and interiors of temples. Maps and diagrams help to visualize history. Footage is also captured of locals performing everyday tasks such as adults polishing wood and sewing and children playing with hula hoops.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amateur film with footage of local farmers working the land. Adults also attend school. Some footage is of ancient artwork including Babalonian artifacts and hieroglyphs. Footage also includes making bread, children playing on swing, and young men honoring the Quran. Nice footage of Mt. Demavand, Persepolis, Tehran, and some young NEF volunteers in the Tehran bazaar.

did.unittitle: A Helping Hand in the Near East

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film serves as a service announcement for agricultural reform in Iran and the bright young minds who are using education to help the community.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The film contains several out-of-focus shots. This periodic blurriness is inherent in the original film, and appears in all additional copies of this title. Most of the unfocused shots appear near the end of this film.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage inside and outside of the city. Inside the city, the architecture and artifacts are a quiet reminder of the past while bustling street scenes are a reminder of the modernization in place. Mountains are visable in the distance.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Visitors sightsee by visiting temples and lakes while also stopping to take a group photo. Different modes of transportation are observed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: Arab Village- The Story of Merj
did.materialspec: 16mm, Acetate, print, 340 feet, Eastman Color, Awind.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of current agricultural technologies and tasks such as water collecting and tending the livestock. Men can be seen having discussions at a meeting while women and children visit the doctor. Same as AV 998.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A more industrial look at the Middle east. This amatuer film captures industrial sites -buildings with pipes and valves- for daily opporation. Views of a ship at sea from the shore. Children are also seen at school.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly still life footage of natural landscapes and vegetation. There is also footage of city buildings in contrast to domed roof huts. In this film, children make numurous appearances acknowledging the camera. By Rev. James T. Albertson of Central Methodist Church and an NEF board member.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film contains aerial shots of both city and countryside from a distance. During visits to historical/religious sites, some visitors meet a religious elder, examine tapestry designs, view ancient scrolls, and visit what appears to be tombs. Some recreational activity such as floating on the beach and swimming take place. A J.T. Albertson Film

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tourists visit Israel and partake in activities such as water sports, entertainment, and sightseeing. The city has a market with goods to admire including art, tapestries, metal works, and sculpting. Camels rides offers transportation to the Egyptian pyramids. Produced by Pan American Airlines.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This short film captures the hardships and victories met by a village when the building of a dam is underway. From flooding to rocky soil, the whole village works together so that they can celebrate the future of a plentiful harvest.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: Boys Haven and Amman Boys Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Majority of footage is a montage of still photography. Footage shows the bunkhouse and classroom of the Boys Haven. Boys learn trades like sewing and wood work while enjoying games such as Dominoes and Chess.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of cityscape and the markets and wares one can find on the streets. Crafts include plates and dishes, wood carving, musicians with dancers, exterior decorations, and animal performers. An appearance of the peace sign from a man waving to the camera. Rural footage is included such as a man made river, mountains, and farmland.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amateur film capturing city monuments such as the colliseum, ancient gardens, and temples with statuary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A film with footage of Gaza locals watching military personal demonstrate techniques used in combat. The women also show flag motions they sign with. Children receive food and eat outside after locals obtain bleached flour.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NARRATED IN PERSIAN WITH PERSIAN TITLES; series of short films documenting what appears to be the immediate aftermath of the 1978 earthquake in Tabas.Reel One: Images of the devastation and of bodies being pulled from rubble.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: series of short films documenting what appears to be the immediate aftermath of the 1978 earthquake in Tabas. Reel Two: Scenes of death, grief and mourning.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of short films documenting what appears to be the immediate aftermath of the 1978 earthquake in Tabas. Reel Three: A visit by government officials, maybe including Prime Minister Amir Abbas Hoveyda.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: series of short films documenting what appears to be the immediate aftermath of the 1978 earthquake in Tabas. Reel Four: The Shah and Queen Farah arrive to survey the destruction and to visit survivors.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: series of short films documenting what appears to be the immediate aftermath of the 1978 earthquake in Tabas. Reel Five: The Royal visit continued; footage of the relief effort and of ordinary Iranians donating money and goods.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of ancient architecture in Athens including the Acropolis and ampitheaters. Some trades are demonstrated such as iron refurbishing, manikin making, and broom making. Children wave to camer then show some athletic activities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of current agricultural technologies and tasks such as water collecting and tending the livestock. Men can be seen having discussions at a meeting while women and children visit the doctor. Same as AV 998. Same as AV 970.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Amateur film of the city and the surrounding rural areas. A look at the life of a local village.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of sights one can see in Egypt. Architectural buildings such as temples are admired. Sailboats can be seen on the river. Even some views of the streets are present.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of city. Some rocky hills on the outskirts are explored and and a stone table is a point of interest.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film documenting patients in a Grecian hospital/clinic. A nurse and some patients are introduced. A handicapped man demonstrates how to exercise and a boy is taought how to lace a boot. School children demostrate exercise regimen.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of ancient architecture in Athens including the Acropolis and ampitheaters. Some natural sites are visited such as some rocky hills and floral gardens.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A Summary of the trip taken to the Middle East. Footage incorporates tourist attractions such as the Egyptian Pyramids and religious sites while also including rural landscapes and the locals who inhabit the area. Lastly, visitors also enjoyed the nearby sea/river.
